feed.title: SAP Community - NW ABAP Gateway (OData)
feed.subtitle: NW ABAP Gateway (OData) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How to use HTTP Post method in SAP Gateway Client using JSON format?
entry.content:
I was trying to update a custom table using the HTTP METHOD POST in SAP Gateway Client. Here's the JSON format that I've used. The fields ZBANDNAME, ZESTDATE, ZMEMBERS are key fields while the ZSTATUS is not and I'm trying to update it.

{
 "ZBANDNAME" : "ONE DIRECTION",
 "ZESTDATE" : "2010",
 "ZMEMBERS" : "FOUR",
 "ZSTATUS"  : "DISBANDED"
}

Upon trying to update the value of a field ZSTATUS in SAP GW Client, I encountered an error message: "The key value is already in use. Please enter a different one."  

How can I avoid this issue and proceed with the update?

entry.title: Service in IDES instance is not reachable
entry.content:
I got myself an IDES instance on cal.sap.com because I wanted to try out some built-in OData service to handle production orders. It seems that the services are configured correctly:

- In transaction SICF under the default_host node there are services, and they are all activated
- In transaction SMICM the ICM is up and running without any obvious problems
- When I switch to ICM -> services, I can see that the port is 0 and the host name is set to a dummy value
- When I try to change port / host there it says "Service HTPP... can not be started" but its already running.
- Trying to adjust host parameters in RZ11 didn't change anything

Can anyone give me hot tip what else to check?

entry.title: Custom message missing in Response Headers from a Post/Create request
entry.content:
There is a property I need from the response headers in a SAPUI5 app, which is "sap-message". It carries some information after a create request on the model in the SAPUI5 front-end.
On the app with a service pointing to Dev, I do get this property ("sap-message") attached to the headers, as you can see in the below.

The problem is that on the app that is on QA this property is not there, not just that it doesn't have a value, it is totally absent. What might be the cause of this and how to fix it?

Any help with greatly be appreciated.

entry.title: How to administrate change documents?
entry.content:
The below Change Document data needs to be retained/archived:

User Change Data:

  • Change history for logon data - USH02
  • Change history for authorizations - USH04
  • Change history for authorization profiles - USH10
  • Change history for authorization values - USH12

 

Role Change Data:

  • CDHDR
  • CDPOS


Kindly advise on how the data can be transferred as CDHDR, CDPOS also contains Change logs from another table as well.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Standard Attachment service- API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV- Unable to open the uploaded file.
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently working on a Fiori Custom application, where I am trying to use the SAP Standard Attachment service- API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV to upload/download attachments to a particular business object.

I am able to use the download the file attached to the business object using the GetAllOriginals Function import with relevant parameters passed to it.

But when I try to upload a file to the business object by passing relevant parameters mentioned below, even though if the file(image/pdf/excel/docx) is getting uploaded, when I try to download the uploaded file, below error occurs. Its says "We dont support this file format" for image file and "Excel cannot open file because file format issue or file extension is not valid" for excel file and for so on.

I am passing below payload and Headers to the POST request of AttachmentContentSet entity.

 var oPayload = {
                    LinkedSAPObjectKey: LinkedSAPObjectKey,
                    BusinessObjectTypeName : ObjectType,
                    FileName: oFile.name,
                    MimeType: oFile.type,
                  Content: oBinaryData, // Binary Data file content,
                    DocumentInfoRecordDocType: "GOS"
                };
 
 var oHeaders = {
                    "Slug": oFile.name,
                    "BusinessObjectTypeName": ObjectType,
                    "LinkedSAPObjectKey": LinkedSAPObjectKey,
                    "X-CSRF-Token" : token,
                    "Content-Type" : oFile.type
                };
 
My query is how the file content should be passed in Payload. I referred many SAP community posts and other blogs, still I could not find how this particular "Content" should be passed in payload. I found POST call in a blog, but they did it using POSTMAN and there its not showing exactly how we should send the data from a javascript code perspective.
 
I tried sending the file content as binary data using File reader and readAsBinaryString() function, the issue is not solved.

 

 

Can anyone who have worked on this type of requirement help me on this?
 
Thanks in advance for your help or suggestions.

entry.title: Is it possible to create ODATA via SEGW to get a JSON output with few basic types & a simple array?
entry.content:
Hi All. Good day.

I would like to know if it is possible to generate the attached JSON output via SEGW ODATA containing a basic type, a structure and a string array.

Field "cities" does not have its own property but it is only a string array. If "cities" had a property like "name", I would have used deep entity to achieve the output.

When I imported a structure having cities as a string table type for creating an entity type, "cities" does not appear in the property of the entity and also in the output though I am able to save the values into the string array using GET_ENTITYSET method.

Kindly guide.

entry.title: Pass empty or encoded values in SET_FORM_FIELD using application/x-www-form-urlencoded in ABAP
entry.content:
I'm working with an ABAP program that sends an HTTP POST request using application/x-www-form-urlencoded content type via CL_HTTP_CLIENT. The API expects a payload like this:

I cannot use SET_CDATA, so I have to use SET_FORM_FIELD. Here's what I'm trying:

{
"amount_to_capture": "50000",
"final_capture": "false",
"amount_details": {
"line_items": ""
}
}

 

ABAP
lo_http_client->request->set_method( 'POST' ). lo_http_client->request->set_header_field( name = 'Content-Type' value = 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' ). lo_http_client->request->suppress_form_fields_in_body( abap_false ).
lo_http_client->request->set_form_field( name = 'amount_to_capture' value = '50000' ). lo_http_client->request->set_form_field( name = 'final_capture' value = 'false' ). lo_http_client->request->set_form_field( name = 'amount_details[line_items]' value = '' ).

But the last field (line_items) is not sent at all when the value is empty (''), which causes the API to reject the request.

Even trying with a space or URL-encoded value like %20 didn't always behave consistently:

 

abap
 
lo_http_client->request->set_form_field( name = 'amount_details[line_items]' value = '%20' ).

How can I force ABAP to send an empty or hex-encoded value using SET_FORM_FIELD in a way that it is included in the request body?

Is there a known workaround for forcing ABAP to include fields with empty values when sending x-www-form-urlencoded content?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAP OData WebService DataModel for CREATE-Operation - Am i doing this the intended way?
entry.content:
I am currently working on a project to upgrade existing SAP Function Models from external RFC to OData Rest-Services.

Certain things are set:

  • it has to be OData and REST
  • the interface has to be as close to the original as possible

The given Function Model has the followong architecture:

  • IMPORT
    • iv_testrun type BOOL
  • EXPORT
    • es_return like BAPIRET2
  • TABLES
    • IT_TIMETICKETS
    • ET_DETAIL_RETURN

The function model works relativly easy:

  • IMPORT is self-explanatory
  • EXPORT is given if something goes wrong which kills the processing
  • TABLES
    • the timetickets which shall be created to an existing order
    • the detailed return gives a message for each given ticket if the creation was succesfull or not and some details what went wrong

Knowing my way around the SEGW and the DPC, DPC_EXT, MPC, MPC_EXT -Classes i designed a webservice with a deep_entity setup.

  1. i created a KEY-Entity with a literal Key called ConfCreate to later connect the importing Values to.
  2. i created the VALUE-Entity which has basically all the inputs of IT_TIMETICKETS. This i connecte via an association with the KEY-Entity settings set on 1 to M.
  3. To get the detailed results i went in my opinion a bit sketchi... i created a third entity called RETURN. this on i also connected to the KEY-Entity with an association.

so overall the segw looks something like this:

and the associations look like this:

lastly i redefined the CREATE_DEEP_ENTITY Method of the DPC_EXT and voilà, it works...
...but its kind of ugly and it feels "done in the wrong way"

so this is the request:

{
  "Testrun": "",
  "Values": {
    "results": [
      {
        "ConfNo": "1",
        "Orderid": "",
        "Operation": "",
        "SubOper": "",
        "CapaCategory": ""
      },
      {
        "ConfNo": "2",
        "Orderid": "",
        "Operation": "",
        "SubOper": "",
        "CapaCategory": ""
      }
    ]
  },
  "Returns": []
}

ConfCreate is, as already explained, the "link" to the Value-Entries.
Testrun defines if it´s a testrun or not. Since both have to be adressable i defined them as KEYS.
And in Values, we have the timeticket-values which we can give noumerous at once into the service.

... And then there is results ... 
this is left blank because it is needed to be automatically in the tech_clauses, which is a string_table defining what goes in AND comes out.

If there should be a general error we get a 40X or 50X http status and if there is a business wrongdoing we get the results filled as intended

this is an example response:

[...]
    "Returns": {
      "results": [
        {
          "__metadata": {
            "id": "https://.../sap/opu/odata/sap/Z...CONF_CREATE_SRV_01/ReturnSet(ConfCreate='',Testrun='')",
            "uri": "https://.../sap/opu/odata/sap/Z...CONF_CREATE_SRV_01/ReturnSet(ConfCreate='',Testrun='')",
            "type": "Z...CONF_CREATE_SRV_01.Return"
          },
          "ConfCreate": "",
          "Testrun": "",
          "Type": "E",
          "MessageId": "RU",
          "MessageNumber": "020",
          "Message": "Rückmeldenr. 1 nicht vorhanden (Bitte Eingabe prüfen)",
          "LogNumber": "",
          "LogMsgNo": "000000",
          "MessageV1": "1",
          "MessageV2": "",
          "MessageV3": "",
          "MessageV4": "",
          "Parameter": "",
          "Row": 1,
          "Field": "",
          "System": "A05_010",
          "FlgLocked": false,
          "ConfNo": "0000000000",
          "ConfCnt": "00000000"
        },
        {
          "__metadata": {
            "id": "https://.../sap/opu/odata/sap/Z...CONF_CREATE_SRV_01/ReturnSet(ConfCreate='',Testrun='')",
            "uri": "https://.../sap/opu/odata/sap/Z...CONF_CREATE_SRV_01/ReturnSet(ConfCreate='',Testrun='')",
            "type": "Z...CONF_CREATE_SRV_01.Return"
          },
          "ConfCreate": "",
          "Testrun": "",
          "Type": "E",
          "MessageId": "RU",
          "MessageNumber": "020",
          "Message": "Rückmeldenr. 2 nicht vorhanden (Bitte Eingabe prüfen)",
          "LogNumber": "",
          "LogMsgNo": "000000",
          "MessageV1": "2",
          "MessageV2": "",
          "MessageV3": "",
          "MessageV4": "",
          "Parameter": "",
          "Row": 2,
          "Field": "",
          "System": "A05_010",
          "FlgLocked": false,
          "ConfNo": "0000000000",
          "ConfCnt": "00000000"
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

so now we come to my question:

Is this really the intended way of solving sth like this?

Is there a more fitting configuration and setup hidden inside the SEGW i do not know yet?

So please, if someone is experienced with mass-creates and explicit returns for each individual create please let me know.

 

Kind Regards
Mirco

entry.title: SAP Service and Asset Manager 2405-Technicians fetch the data for multiple company codes and plants
entry.content:
Dear Experts, 

We are in advanced stage of SAP Service and Asset Manager 2405 application. We were asked to implement the following task in SSAM 2405. The expectation is "Field Technicians should fetch the data across the multiple plants and multiple company codes". I referred the SAP Community and KBAs and I understood this feature is part of SSAM 2410 application which is not available in SSAM 2405 and needs customization for this. However I would like to know the feasibility to achieve the expectation especially for "Fetching the data across the multiple company codes". Is this possible technically and functional wise? I referred the SAP Note 3491448, it is not mentioned about the company codes and mentioned about only plants and work centers and other parameters. Please let me know if this is something feasible for multiple company codes.

 

Thanks and Regards

Pavan

 

SAP Service and Asset Manager

entry.title: post array using ODataV4 / V2
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

 

I have this JSON Post in Odata 

{
"brand" : "ShopRite",
"fundingType" : 10,
"offerCode" : "25041101",
"gs1CoPrefix" : "",
"familyCode" : "0",
"offerSeries" : "1",
"manufacturerCodes" : [ "text", "text2" ],
"taxesReclaimable" : false,
"isTender" : false
}

manufacturerCodes is the array expected by the client.

How can we configure and implement a system to handle arrays in SEGW for OData? I know there are complex types or Collection types in V4, but those require a property (the sub-object has a field label like)  

"manufacturerCodes" : [  code: "text",

                                        code "text2" ]

or 

"manufacturerCodes" : [ { code: "text", }

                                       { code: "text2"  }

                                  ],

Any idea? Is there any standard approach to post a field with an array to SAP OData?

If we post, I'm having this error: "error while parsing an XML stream". Already tried using a collection or complex type.

 

Please
Thanks a lot for your time to help

entry.title: Enhancing VIM fiori app Gateway service
entry.content:
Hello all, 

I am trying to check for the feasiblity to enhance the gateway service for Vendor Invoice management application provided by OpenText. The gateway service is PF05_DATA. I have run through a few posts but there is not enough information that helps me to understand if this gateway service can be enhanced. I could only get the service name and the data provider class. The data provider class has various FMs one of which is /OTX/PF62_GET_3_OBJECTS, is it possible to enhance this FM for a different set of users without impacting the existing Fiori app functionality and how do we enhance ?

entry.title: Issue with Finding Entities in SAP Standard API for Equipment MarkForDeletion Functionality
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I am currently working on utilizing the SAP Standard API for equipment management, specifically to implement the "MarkForDeletion" functionality. I referred to the API details on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, where I found the following endpoints related to equipment deletion:

  • POST /ResetEQUIPFromInactive
  • POST /SetEQUIPToInactive
  • POST /SetEQUIPToMarkedForDeletion

I have attached a snapshot from the Business Accelerator Hub showing these endpoints for reference (Snapshot 1).

However, when I checked the available entity sets in the SAP Gateway Client using transaction code /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE for the service /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_EQUIPMENT/, I could not find the corresponding entities or operations for the above endpoints. The entity sets I found are limited to:

  • EQUIPClassCharacteristicValue
  • EQUIPMENT
  • EQUIPMENTClass
  • EQUIPMENTClassCharacteristic
  • EQUIPMENTLONGTEXT
  • EQUIPMENTPARTNER
  • EQUIPMENTWARRANTY

I have attached a snapshot from the SAP Gateway Client showing the available entity sets (Snapshot 2).

My questions are:

  1. Where can I find the detailed implementation or metadata for the SetEQUIPToMarkedForDeletion functionality in the SAP system?
  2. Are these endpoints (ResetEQUIPFromInactive, SetEQUIPToInactive, SetEQUIPToMarkedForDeletion) part of a different service or require additional configuration to be visible in the Gateway Client?
  3. How can I proceed with using the "MarkForDeletion" functionality for equipment via the API?

We are keen on using this functionality for our project, so any guidance on how to locate or enable these operations would be greatly appreciated.

Looking forward to your insights!

Attachments:

  • Snapshot 1: Business Accelerator Hub API Endpoints
  • Snapshot 2: SAP Gateway Client Entity Sets

Thank you,

entry.title: OData response time increased significantly after model changes and reduces after 8-9 hours
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am facing a strange issue.

I have built an unmanaged RAP application with 8 entities in SAP on-prem system where all of them are related to each other via associations and compositions. Each entity on an average are having around 25-30 fields. I have created cds, behavior, metadata extensions, service definition and OData V2 UI service binding.

All works good, but the issue is, whenever I change any thing in my model like field logic, or add additional field etc., OData response slows down significantly.

It takes around 35 - 40 seconds to load metadata sometimes it takes even minutes. It again fastens up after 8 - 9 hours and loads in 600 - 800ms.

I tried doing everything including

invalidating global cache

invalidating client cache

invalidating metadata cache

I even tried running report /UI5/UPD_ODATA_METADATA_CACHE

Nothing helps

I would be happy to know what is the potential cause for this and how to resolve

 

metadata loads in 670ms without any modifications.

 

Same service taking 35 seconds after field modification

entry.title: How to call Merge request to update a draft table entry for a custom field in Gateway Client
entry.content:
Dear experts,

The requirement is to extend the fiori app 'Manage Purchase Requisition Professional' (F2229) with custom fields. The custom fields are added successfully via Custom Fields app on PR line items. The requirement is to make these custom fields available on header level for Create/Update/Read operations. This is a draft enabled app and we would like to call Merge requests on draft record of the item. Kindly suggest how a merge request can be tested on this line item draft in the gateway client.

Thanks.

entry.title: How to upload Classification Characteristic Values to Document Info Record
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

the API Documents | Document Info Record | SAP Business Accelerator Hub  allows the creation of document info records using an OData Service. 

The API also allows the retrieval of the classification of a document info record (" Item node that contains classification values. Only Read operation is supported ")

We currently have an option to create the document info record and upload/link attachments via an API via an connected system. But the maintenance of the of classification of the document and valuation of the characteristics must be done manual in the system. 

Is there also an API to maintain values to a classification characteristic? 

Thank you for the help.

Florian

entry.title: System query option '$count' not supported on expand
entry.content:
Hello,

When I try to use the operation $count into an $expand in an OData V4 call for an SAP  API :

/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0001/Product?$expand=_ProductUnitOfMeasure($count=true)

I have the following error : 501 : Not Implemented
System query option '$count' not supported on expand

 

 

For other operation, like "select" for example, it's working well :

/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0001/Product?$expand=_ProductUnitOfMeasure($select=QuantityNumerator)

Regarding documentation, "count" seems to be an operation supported by OData : https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionexpand

Any idea ?

entry.title: Do not display deleted line item in sap adobe form output using SAP S4 using Gateway service
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am using SAP gateway service to develope SAP ADOBE form using the interface i want to omit the deleted line item in form output.

I am following the below steps to produce form output.

1. Create PO with 3 line items and save it.

2. Delete 1 line item from the PO and approve it using the Front End and corresponding output is generated in which i have omited    the deleted line item so the output contains 2 line items.

3. Now i change the PO after apprval and delete another line item this time for the change po i should get only the recently deleted line item in the Change PO output i.e only 2 line items.

Could you please let me know from which table in SAP S4 could i use to add logic.

entry.title: Problem with ODATA /IWBEP/USERMANAGEMENT (/IWBEP/CM_MGW_RT/027)
entry.content:
Good morning,

After activating the OData service /IWBEP/USERMANAGEMENT, I’m able to use the CurrentUser and UserCollection('UserName') endpoints successfully.

However, when I attempt to call UserCollection to retrieve all user entities, I receive the following error:

"code": "/IWBEP/CM_MGW_RT/027",
"message": {
   "lang": "en",
   "value": "Operation 'Query' not supported for entity type 'User'"
}

According to the service metadata, calling UserCollection should return all user entities.

Could you please confirm whether this issue is due to:

  • The UserCollection entity set not being implemented by SAP in this standard service, or

  • A misconfiguration on our application server side?

Have a nice day.
